page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Stanford le Hope is a small settlement located just north of the R.Thames, some 28 miles from London, in the borough of Thurrock. The 1981 Census recorded a population of 10,609,an increase of 3% from 1971. Recent housing developments have virtually joined Stanford to its neighbour, Corringham. To the east of Stanford, on what was once marshland, are two large oil refineries, Shell Haven and Coryton. Between Stanford and these refineries is a narrow belt of farmland about 1km wide. To the south is a large area of sand and gravel workings,partly reclaimed for recreational purposes,partly actively worked and partly undergoing refill with refuse carried down the Thames from London by barge.
